question_text: What is the definition of an IT asset?

choices.text: A particular set of settings or options on a given piece of equipment
choices.explanation: This option describes a configuration or setting of a piece of equipment rather than the concept of an IT asset. It focuses on the settings or options of the equipment rather than the equipment itself. Therefore, this option is incorrect.

choices.text: Any valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of an IT product or service **(Correct)**
choices.explanation: This option accurately defines an IT asset. An IT asset refers to any valuable component, tangible or intangible, that contributes to the delivery of an IT product or service. This definition encompasses a wide range of items, including hardware, software, data, facilities, and personnel, among others. Therefore, this option is correct.

choices.text: A means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating outcomes that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks
